lexUnit.name: perspire.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give out sweat through the pores of the skin as a result of heat, physical exertion, or stress.

sentence.text: The skin can not , however , absorb essential oils if it is perspiring -- after a sauna for instance .
With humidity soaring he was already perspiring .
He was perspiring and would have liked to take off his jacket .
Colonel Feather 's face was getting red , and he was beginning to perspire .
She was scarlet in the face and perspiring profusely by the time she entered the old gentleman 's room .
Standing there with his schooner of sherry , perspiring a little at the temples , clearly not in his element , and trying painfully hard to overcome it .
By the time we got there , perspiring and struggling within the crowd , it was impossible to have a thought in one 's head except to join in whatever was going on .
In small fields , hay makers worked , perspiring with the heat .
In the hall Kruger took out his handkerchief and mopped his perspiring face .
They lay there together for several minutes gasping and perspiring .
He perspired a lot , he enthused a lot .
After half an hour on the bed in the dry heat he was really enjoying himself and was perspiring profusely .
Also , there 's a theory that when males and females perspire , they give off ` pheromones " -- scents which are strong sexual attractants with a powerful effect on the unconscious mind .
Avoid the sun during the middle of the day and reapply the sun-cream , especially when swimming ( water reflects and intensifies UV rays ) or perspiring heavily .
